roleset.name: to save or relieve from

example.name: spare-v: all arguments
example.text: Many women may even see the dead embryo they have expelled , a sight [0]-2 the surgical-abortion industry typically spares them [*T*-2].

example.name: spare-v: prepositional Arg2
example.text: Several factors apparently spared the Valley -- a sprawling suburban stretch from San Jose to Palo Alto -- from the kind of impact felt in San Francisco , an hour 's drive north .
example.arg: the Valley -- a sprawling suburban stretch from San Jose to Palo Alto --
from the kind of impact felt in San Francisco , an hour 's drive north

example.name: spare-v: peril as syntactic subject
example.text: Others are trying to find specialty defense work spared [* by the slowdown or new niches created by budget-cutting.

example.name: sparing-n: arg 1
example.text: rectosigmoid sparing which will hopefully assist with surgical decision-making
example.arg: which will hopefully assist with surgical decision-making

roleset.note: SPARE-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. VN class bill-54.5. Frames created by Olga (from spare.01-v)
SPARING-N NOTES: Based on temprel data. Comparison to spare.01. Spare.01 is a member of VN class bill-54.5. Framed by Katie (from sparing.01-n)

roleset.name: have extra left over, which can be given away or saved

example.name: spare-v: transitive
example.text: A private challenge to the monolithic tractor industry will take more time and money than Poland can spare [*?* , although a smokehouse or a local dairy can spring up fast .

example.name: spare-v
example.text: Rumsfeld said the Army was sparing no expense or effort to acquire as many Humvees and other vehicles with extra armor as it can .
example.arg: to acquire as many Humvees and other vehicles with extra armor as it can

roleset.note: SPARE-V NOTES: Member of VNcls bill-54.5. Updated by Julia, 12/2010. (from spare.02-v)
